pullRequest.title: SAK-43140 Library: Improve hover and active states of favorites menu
pullRequest.bodyText:
https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-43140
Also fixes https://jira.sakaiproject.org/browse/SAK-43134
I've attached a gif in JIRA of the solution I'd like to push, contains:

higher contrast of all states of favorites against white background
subtle raised elevation (box-shadow) on hover
separate active states to differentiate click vs hover
better CSS custom property abstraction and assignment to make use of the new sakai-active-color variables
fixes an error in the focus definition keeping it from using --focus-outline-color
cleans up some duplicate CSS in modules/navigation/_base.scss

nodes.bodyText: color set in light.scss as transparent. using 1px solid here allows for easier theming, only need to update the color in your theme.
had to reorder. outline-color did not take affect when declared prior to outline
moved from large section removed later in file, was the only selector/rule that wasn't duplicate.
This was a 3rd definition of sitesNav__submenu that Shawn and I could not find need for when review the current state of the code. Moved relevant rules elsewhere and deleted the duplicate rules.
Begin making use of the new sakai-active colors for easier theming. If this PR is merged, tool menu and other areas will receive similar treatment as favorites did above.
Is this gotosite rule no longer needed? I didn't see it move anywhere else.
This :after was used to add an arrow to the "Go to site to view all" item at the bottom. Do you not want the arrow anymore?
Do you want "hover-color" here or just normal "color"?
